data.title: Great local eatery located downtown
data.text: This local eatery has blossomed from a single location to 3 now I believe.  They have a great mix of breakfast food, mexican food and of course burgers.  Their burgers are always great and I've never had a bad experience with the breakfast burritos or tacos.  Make sure you take the time to find one of these great locations.  Support local businesses!

data.title: Wet Burrito
data.text: Jim's wet burrito is one of the best asada burritos in town. Homeade chips on the side are a great touch as well. This burrito will get you full, great portions for the money.

data.title: Burrito
data.text: Amazing!!!!! The steak burrito is a delicious and filling entree. For a little extra $ get a wet burrito with chips and sauce.

data.title: Great mexican food
data.text:
My husband and I stopped for dinner. Service was friendly, you order then they bring you your food. Food was great! We had tacos and burritos. I had a pork and chix taco,  my husband had a steak burrito.
We would stop there again when we go through Souix City.

data.title: Great burgers not so great building
data.text: My husband and I were really hungry for burgers and used trip advisor to look for the best burgers in Sioux City which brought us to Jim's burgers. We were a little hesitant upon arrival as the building is pretty rundown on the inside, however we thought the burgers were excellent and of course because they also serve Mexican food we had to try a steak taco as well because it was only one dollar and it was very authentic and excellent as well. We also had the jalapeño curds which were great and a great price too. We would Absolutely visit again because we really thought the taste was amazing don't let the looks of the building fool you.

data.title: Terrible, made me sick
data.text: Not great going down, even worse after!  Pretty bland and boring.  Too much tortilla not enough meat.  Work up in the middle of the night and thought I was dying.  Worst stomach ache ever.

data.title: Best Place for mexican food
data.text: Don't understand why the name is Jim's Burgers (they do have burgers) They are know for having some of the best Mexican food in town.

data.title: Simple; Lots of Options
data.text: This place is very simple and a little dated, but there were tons of choices on the menu in a variety of different cuisine styles. The food was good and the staff were to the point and friendly. Close location to downtown is nice.

data.title: Don't judge on outward appearance
data.text:
Corner place on Pierce Street, dark windows, sign could use fresh paint, Entry door is kind of tucked into the building. Doesn't look bad on the outside, but doesn't make you think you are going to get such a delicious meal, either. The food was really good and the place was clean. Jim's Burger's menu, on a white board & chalk board, had a variety of burgers along with tacos & burtitos. We both had the wet burrito. You get a very fair size portion and the price was so reasonable at 6.50. Delicious but just on the verge of being too spicey hot for us. Next time we'll order light on the hot peppers. A few tortillia chips were served on the plate with the burrito but no salsa.  Order at the counter, they bring it to you. Service was fine and pleasant and we didn't wait long for food. We were there for an early dinner, 4pm-ish, so there was only a couple other tables filled. They have a couple tv's hanging. Spainish tv was on when we got there, but when we sat down I noticed it had been changed to Ellen. That was accommodating of them.
Next time we're in downtown SC, we will definately go back to try the burgers or more Mexican. Or, might even make a special trip, it was that good.

data.title: Good burger - low atmosphere
data.text: Really good burger and fries - very few folks for a Saturday night - big big burgers so have a great leftover for tomorrow.  The place is 50% Mexican selections so should it be called "Jim and Jaime's Burgers and Tacos?"

data.title: Good variety
data.text: Had the asada tacos and a peach malt...strange combination but I chose it and it was delicious.  Very busy at lunch time fore variety than other Mexican restaurants.

data.title: Terrific lunch place
data.text: The name is misleading, as it's more than just a burger joint.  While the burgers are very good, the Mexican food is also top notch.  I usually end up ordering the taco special, which is a great value.  And the service is always fast and friendly.

data.title: Great food and great place to get a good meal!
data.text: This by far one of the best hamb urger places in town.Your food is always made to order and is always hot off the grill.  The service is at the front counter and your food is delivered to your table within minutes.  Never had a burger there I didn't like.  Made just the way you order it.  Prices are very reasonable.

data.title: Average Burger Place - Nothing Terribly Special.
data.text: Burgers were just okay. They were skinny and fried, nothing special. The restaurant could use some updating. Everyone was friendly and the food, though not what I was expecting, was fresh. I've heard they have good Mexican, maybe we'll try that and see if it's better.

user_location.name: Rapid City, South Dakota, United States

data.title: great burgers
data.text: found this place by accident and ended up loving the burgers! definitely a place you have to try if your are new in town

data.title: Frequent visitor
data.text: The best breakfast in town, hands down. No one offers better bacon than what i receive at Jim's. Asada tacos are fantastic.

data.title: better than La Juanita
data.text: title says it all.  The other joint is overrated.  Have eaten here many times and always good. Better than the other

data.title: decent food
data.text: Jim's is not a chain it is a pretty good burger place, I like the zucchini fries and it is reasonably priced

data.title: MORE THAN BURGERS
data.text: Stopped in with a customer that had eaten here before!  I expected burgers, but, they have MUCH more to offer!  We ordered the lunch specials for the day.  Steak (asada) tacos, and taco special...GREAT portion and HOME cooked!!!  I'll have to stop again when in town and try a burger!
